meanings.definition: A line of vehicles moving slowly or stopped on a road.
meanings.sent1: During rush hour, the tailbacks on the highway can be frustrating.
meanings.sent2: The tailbacks on the freeway were due to a car breakdown.
meanings.sent3: The tailbacks on the street made everyone late for work.
meanings.sent4: The tailbacks resembled a colorful snake winding through the city.
meanings.sent5: The long tailbacks seemed never-ending, like a row of toy cars.

meanings.definition: A buildup of traffic caused by congestion or an accident.
meanings.sent1: The tailbacks on the bridge were caused by a sudden storm.
meanings.sent2: Avoiding tailbacks during peak hours can save time on your commute.
meanings.sent3: The tailbacks on the road turned a regular drive into a traffic nightmare.
meanings.sent4: The tailbacks looked like a giant parking lot stretching for miles.
meanings.sent5: The tailbacks were so dense, it felt like being stuck in a maze of cars.
